result.execSummary:
The defendant Desiree M Desouza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Set at $1,262.00.  Payable to Jay J.  Joint and several with any coactors convicted of this offense.

Pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments, DNA surcharge are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Elaine C., Dreacy A.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
Follow all rules of Extended Supervision.
Pay all supervision fees.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay the related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have bee restored.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desiree M Desouza

defendant.name: Desouza, Desiree M
defendant.address: 9442 West Fond Du Lac Ave, #6, Milwaukee, WI 53225

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (21 pages) commencing FEBRUARY 25, 2016 received and filed. kl

Defendant Desiree M Desouza in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Desiree M Desouza in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS, consecutive to case 15CF2097, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $1,262.00 payable to Jay J. joint/several with any co-actors convicted of this offense
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment 
-No contact with Elaine C., Dreacy A.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felony she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet

Defendant Desiree M Desouza in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Desiree M Desouza in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.

Defendant Desiree M Desouza in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Desiree M Desouza in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for Tom Potter for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court grants defense request for adjournment.    Court ordered case adjourned for soft projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Desiree M Desouza in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Desiree M Desouza in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Attorney Plaisted newly appointed.  Court orders case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Desiree M Desouza in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Desiree M Desouza in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney Garvin Guimont's motion to withdraw heard and granted.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case recalled.  Appearances remain the same.  Parties met in chambers.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Desiree M Desouza in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Desiree M Desouza in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Statements heard from parties.  Case passed.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

At first call attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested that the defendant be produced.  Arrangments were made.

At second call, defendant Desiree M Desouza in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, defense requested a plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 22.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Desiree M Desouza not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Desiree M Desouza not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Desiree M Desouza not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case in court for scheduling conference and bail review.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES defense motion for bail reduction.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES state motion for bail increase.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Desiree M Desouza in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Desiree M Desouza in custody.  Patrick Anderson for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: JAY J.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Desiree M Desouza in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Desiree M Desouza in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. 
Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
